text: Athos Solomou (; born November 30, 1985 in Limassol, Cyprus) is a Cypriot professional footballer who plays for Haringey Borough in the Isthmian League Premier Division. He is mainly a right winger but he also plays as right back also. ==Club career== ===Apollon Limassol=== Solomou started his career from Apollon Limassol's Academy. He maded his debut with Apollon on season 2002-03. He stayed in Apollon for 7 years and he won one Cypriot Championship and one Cypriot Super Cup with the team. ===APOEL=== On 10 September 2009 Solomou signed a three-years contract with APOEL and the next season he helped APOEL to win the 2010–11 Cypriot First Division. He also appeared in three 2011–12 UEFA Champions League matches for APOEL, in the club's surprising run to the quarter-finals of the competition. At the end of the 2012–13 season, he became champion again with APOEL, after winning the 2012–13 Cypriot First Division. During the 2013–14 season, he appeared in three 2013–14 UEFA Europa League group stage matches for APOEL and won all the titles in Cyprus, the Cypriot League, the Cypriot Cup and the Cypriot Super Cup. On 2 June 2014, APOEL announced that it would not renew the contract with the player and after five successful years, Solomou left the club. ===Rah Ahan=== On 20 January 2016, Solomou joined Persian Gulf League side Rah Ahan on a 6-month contract for an undisclosed fee.http://www.tasnimnews.com/en/news/2016/01/22/977793/maritimo- signs-iran-goalkeeper-alireza-haghighi ===Later career=== Solomou joined AEZ Zakakiou for the 2016–17 season, but made only four appearances. In the 2017–18 season, he played for FC International Limassol in the fifth tier. He joined Digenis Oroklinis in the Cypriot Second Division in the 2018–19 season, but did not play any games and dropped down a division to play for Ethnikos Assia. After briefly joining Elpida Astromeriti in June 2019, Solomou moved to England and joined Haringey Borough for the 2019–20 season. ==Honours== ; Apollon Limassol *Cypriot First Division (1) : 2005–06 *Cypriot Super Cup (1) : 2006 ; APOEL *Cypriot First Division (3) : 2010–11, 2012–13, 2013–14 *Cypriot Cup (1) : 2013–14 *Cypriot Super Cup (2) : 2011, 2013 ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:Living people Category:1985 births Category:Apollon Limassol FC players Category:APOEL FC players Category:Enosis Neon Paralimni FC players Category:ASC Oțelul Galați players Category:Doxa Katokopias FC players Category:Rah Ahan players Category:AEZ Zakakiou players Category:Digenis Oroklinis players Category:Ethnikos Assia FC players Category:Haringey Borough F.C. players Category:Cypriot First Division players Category:Cypriot Second Division players Category:Liga I players Category:Persian Gulf Pro League players Category:Isthmian League players Category:Cypriot footballers Category:Cyprus international footballers Category:Cypriot expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Romania Category:Expatriate footballers in Iran Category:Expatriate footballers in England Category:Association football midfielders
title: Athos Solomou
